intro: Lepidadenia mollis, commonly known as the soft lepidadenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
